S3.T1.caption: TABLE I: Advantages and Disadvantages of Each Database
S3.T1.table:
Database Advantages Disadvantages
IEEE Xplore • High-quality, peer-reviewed content. • Specializes in technical literature in electrical engineering, computer science, and electronics. • Advanced search features. Most of the content is paid.
SpringerLink • Offers access to millions of scientific documents from journals, books, series, protocols, and reference works. • Content from various disciplines. • High-quality, peer-reviewed content. Full access usually requires a subscription.
ACM Digital Library • Comprehensive collection of ACM’s publications. • Provides access to a broad range of computer science material. • High-quality, peer-reviewed content. Full access usually requires a subscription.
references: Table I reviews the databases used for this SLR in terms of their advantages and disadvantages. The most important feature of all the three databases is that they are focused on technology and have sound peer-review process to guarantee the quality of publications.

S3.T2.table:
keyword synonyms
educational learning, training, teaching, tutoring
recommender intelligent, adaptive
system -
references: After a set of trials and preliminary exploration, we also added synonyms to ”educational” and ”recommender”. As the synonyms of ”educational”, we used ”learning”, ”training”, ”teaching”, and ”tutoring”. For ”recommender”, we used ”intelligent” and ”adaptive” (Table II).

references: In this subsection, we review the analysis criteria directly relating to the research questions (section III-A). The analysis data is shown in Table IV.

To summarize, our objective was to review how educational recommender systems (ERS) optimize learning. We reviewed the target metrics used in existing ERS with the corresponding evaluation methods. Since we define learning as the achievement of learning outcomes, we also reviewed how they implemented outcome-based assessment. The summary results of our review are presented in Table IV. In the following section, we elaborate our findings in the light of research questions, offer interpretations, and discuss some of the limitations and further work.
